trans-unit.source: Provides support for building a set of related custom designers.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner> interface derives from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner> interface and provides support for flexibly navigating a hierarchy of related designers.
With this interface, a programmer can supply a number of designers for the component, with the appropriate one being determined dynamically.

This interface is a simple extension of its base class, adding just two properties for navigating a tree hierarchy: <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner.Children%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner.Parent%2A>.
For an overview of creating design components, see [Extending Design-Time Support](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d6ac8a6a-42fd-4bc8-bf33-b212811297e2).
Gets a collection of child designers.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner.Children%2A> property will return an empty collection if the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITreeDesigner> has no child objects.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>, containing the collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner"></xref> child objects of the current designer.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner"></xref> representing the parent designer, or `null` if there is no parent.
